intro: Lomatium scabrum var. scabrum, commonly known as scabrous lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges, preferring well-drained soils. It is part of the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is known for its aromatic, often bitter-tasting leaves. The species is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various invertebrates.
